author: Kallol Bhattacherjee
text:
India and Nepal are scheduled to hold more talks this week on the sidelines of a SAARC meeting, days before Nepal Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli’s visit to China.

On Wednesday, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj will fly to Nepal and will hold talks with her Nepal counterpart Kamal Thapa on Thursday. Nepal’s Ambassador Deep Kumar Upadhyay told The Hindu that a significant meeting would also take place between Ms. Swaraj and Mr. Oli in view of the latter’s March 20 visit to Beijing.

“The visit to China is the second foreign trip of Prime Minister Oli and we expect the trip to be historic in nature, and that is why Mr. Oli will give a preview of the trip during his discussions with Ms. Swaraj”, Mr. Upadhyay said.
title: Nepal to brief India on Oli’s China visit
